files.README.md:
üêß Welcome to Fedora Linux on WebTerm!

‚ú® Features:
- DNF package management simulation
- GNOME desktop environment (default)
- Latest software packages
- Strong developer focus
- SELinux security

üìö Getting Started:
- Type 'help' to see all available commands
- Type 'dnf search' to search for packages
- Type 'rpm -qa' to list installed packages
- Type 'firewall-cmd --list-all' for firewall info

üé® This is a simulation of Fedora 38 Workstation.
Explore the cutting-edge Linux experience!

üí° Pro tip: Try 'neofetch' to see your Fedora system info!
files.notes.txt:
üìù Fedora User Notes:

üéØ Todo:
- Update system with 'sudo dnf update'
- Enable RPM Fusion repositories
- Install multimedia codecs
- Configure development environment

üí≠ Fedora Features:
- Latest software packages (6-month releases)
- GNOME desktop by default
- Strong focus on developers
- SELinux enabled by default
- Flatpak support
- Wayland by default

üöÄ Completed:
‚úÖ Initial Fedora setup
‚úÖ WebTerm configuration
‚úÖ Basic command familiarity
files..bashrc:
# .bashrc

# Source global definitions
if [ -f /etc/bashrc ]; then
	. /etc/bashrc
fi

# User specific environment
if ! [[ "$PATH" =~ "$HOME/.local/bin:$HOME/bin:" ]]
then
    PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$HOME/bin:$PATH"
fi
export PATH

# Fedora aliases
alias ll='ls -alF --color=auto'
alias la='ls -A --color=auto'
alias l='ls -CF --color=auto'
alias grep='grep --color=auto'

# Fedora-specific aliases
alias dnf-search='dnf search'
alias dnf-info='dnf info'
alias rpm-qa='rpm -qa'

# User specific aliases and functions
if [ -d ~/.bashrc.d ]; then
	for rc in ~/.bashrc.d/*; do
		if [ -f "$rc" ]; then
			. "$rc"
		fi
	done
fi

unset rc
files.fedora-info.txt:
üîí Important Fedora Information:

üìã System Details:
- Distribution: Fedora 38 Workstation
- Kernel: Linux 6.3.12-200.fc38.x86_64
- Desktop: GNOME 44
- Package Manager: DNF + RPM
- Security: SELinux enforcing

üõ†Ô∏è Key Commands:
- sudo dnf update
- sudo dnf install package-name
- rpm -qa | grep package
- systemctl status service-name
- firewall-cmd --list-all

üåê Resources:
- Fedora Official: https://getfedora.org
- Community: https://ask.fedoraproject.org
- Documentation: https://docs.fedoraproject.org

motd: ‚ú® Features: DNF | GNOME | SELinux | Latest Software
üí° Type 'help' for available commands | 'theme' to toggle themes
üéØ Try: dnf search, rpm -qa, firewall-cmd --list-all, neofetch

help.description: Shows a list of available commands with descriptions

ls.description: Lists files and directories in the current location

pwd.description: Prints the current working directory path
